    Utility methods for common Database and DatabaseQuery tasks.

    • Method Detail

      • getAllAtoms

        public static java.util.Set<GroundAtom> getAllAtoms(Database db,
                                    Predicate p)
        Returns all GroundAtoms of a Predicate persisted in a Database.

        GroundAtoms are retrieved by executing the query returned by getQueryForAllAtoms(Predicate) and calling Database.getAtom(Predicate, GroundTerm...) on each result.

        Parameters:
        db - the Database to query for GroundAtoms
        p - the Predicate of the GroundAtoms to return
        Returns:
        all GroundAtoms of p in db

      • getQueryForAllAtoms

        public static DatabaseQuery getQueryForAllAtoms(Predicate p)
        Returns a DatabaseQuery that matches any GroundAtom of a Predicate.

        The query is a QueryAtom of the given Predicate with a different Variable for each argument.

        Parameters:
        p - the Predicate of the Atoms to return
        Returns:
        the query

      • getQueryAtom

        public static QueryAtom getQueryAtom(Database db,
                     Predicate p,
                     java.lang.Object... rawArgs)
        Constructs a QueryAtom from raw arguments using convertArguments(Database, Predicate, Object...).
        Parameters:
        db - the Database to use to get a UniqueID
        p - the Predicate of the QueryAtom
        rawArgs - the arguments to the QueryAtom (after conversion)
        Returns:
        the QueryAtom
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any element of rawArgs could not be converted to a valid type or is already a GroundTerm of an invalid type

      • convertArguments

        public static Term[] convertArguments(Database db,
                      Predicate p,
                      java.lang.Object... rawArgs)
        Converts raw arguments to Terms that fit a given Predicate.

        Returns Terms such that they match the ArgumentTypes of a Predicate. Any raw argument that is already a Term is returned as is. Any other raw argument will be used to construct a GroundTerm of the appropriate type if possible.

        Parameters:
        db - the Database to use to get a UniqueID
        p - the Predicate to match the arguments to
        rawArgs - the arguments to convert
        Returns:
        the converted terms
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any element of rawArgs could not be converted to a valid type or is already a GroundTerm of an invalid type
